58996005f899.title: Hmmm…your sub-heading “When a quantum interaction happens, one interpretation leads to an infinite…

paragraphs.text: Hmmm…your sub-heading “When a quantum interaction happens, one interpretation leads to an infinite number of parallel Universes.” should state “When a quantum interaction happens, one interpretation could lead to an infinite number of parallel Universes.” It’s all theoretical! :)
paragraphs.name: 8caa

2537f81a1806.title: Perhaps only what we observe is “real”.

paragraphs.text: Perhaps only what we observe is “real”. Perhaps consciousness is somehow central to the problem — not peripheral. If so, that means that all those infinities are not really there, because we can’t observe them.
Fascinating! Thanx for that!
paragraphs.name: 13cf

paragraphs.text: This is an area I happened to have looked into.
paragraphs.name: fcb3

paragraphs.text: The ‘Many Worlds’ interpretation of quantum theory came about to do away with the seeming probabilistic nature of quantum interactions, such as the double slit situation. Each branch, or world, is supposedly completely deterministic. You didn’t mention this in your article.
paragraphs.name: b5e1

7f6bbd755450.title: Just what physical tests could be made to verify that multiverses exist?

paragraphs.text: Just what physical tests could be made to verify that multiverses exist? Until those tests can be made and the results verified, the multiverse hypothesis will remain fantasy, like time travel or Isaac Asimov’s Galactic Empire.
What a great article!

I don’t buy the QM Universe Splits solution to parallel universes. This is because we are made of the same stuff as the universe! This means the universe splits whenever a particular dense part of the universe (us!) reacts and maintains state about some QM event. Does that mean inside other dense areas…
